documents: The Implementing Agency (IA) takes action to implement a case once the purchaser has signed the case and provided the USG with any required initial deposit.

On an exception basis, the DSCA (Office of Business Operations (OBO)) Country Finance Director (CFD)), with approval from the Division Chief, may process an emergency implementation (EI) of an FMS case.
Delayed case implementation occurs when a case does not implement prior to the Offer Expiration Date (OED).

Because rapid delivery of defense articles, services, and training purchased through the FMS process constitutes a tangible demonstration of U.S. commitment to the government-to-government relationship with the purchaser, every effort should be made to deliver the articles, services, or training in a timely manner.
Acquisition for Foreign Military Sales (FMS) purchasers must be in accordance with DoD regulations and other applicable USG procedures.
Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Instruction (CJCSI) 4110.01F, Joint Material Priorities and Allocation, establishes priorities for filling requisitions.

metadatas.section_title: Compliance with Department of Defense Regulations and Procedures
